text: Just wondering about everyone's processes for re-ordering rows in a HubDB table.  I'm assuming the only way to do it is export, edit, import.
Kinda wishing for drag and drop to move rows
what do you need to re-order them for? presentation on a page? I usually have a sort field if I need to do that
Sort field is a good call
I'm just wondering if that would get a little too confusing with the table I'm working with.  Approx 70 rows

I’ve explained it to clients and they generally understand it well.
I wouldn’t be opposed to having an artificial column in the DB that’s a drag the row feature kinda thing and shows up in the DB  data as a sort column with a number
it doesn’t always make sense to have though, for example if you have an event calendar you’re going to sort by the dates not the sort order
Presumably you'd still be able to sort by whatever column you wanted, and that would just affect the default order
correct, if you wanted to sort by the sort order field you would need to add &sort_by=sort-column or whatever, just like any other columnb
